t: Job 7
Job: My Suffering Is Comfortless
“Is*ipn there*i not a time of hard service for man on earth? Are*ild not*i his days also like the days of a hired man?
Like*ld a servant who earnestly desires the shade, And*ld like a hired man who eagerly looks for his wages,
So*ld I have been allotted months of futility, And*ld wearisome nights have been appointed to me.
When*ld I lie down, I say, ‘When shall I arise, And*ld the night be ended?’ For*ld I have had my fill of tossing till dawn.
My*ld flesh is caked with worms and dust, My*ld skin is cracked and breaks out afresh.
“My*ln days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle, And*ld are spent without hope.
Oh,*ld remember that my life is*i a breath! My*ld eye will never again see good.
The*ld eye of him who sees me will see me no more;*i While*ild your eyes are*i upon me, I shall no longer be.*i
As*ild the cloud disappears and vanishes away, So*ld he who goes down to the grave does not come up.
He*ld shall never return to his house, Nor*ld shall his place know him anymore.
“Therefore*ln I will not restrain my mouth; I*ld will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I*ld will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
Am*ild I a sea, or a sea serpent, That*ld You set a guard over me?
When*ld I say, ‘My bed will comfort me, My*ld couch will ease my complaint,’
Then*ld You scare me with dreams And*ld terrify me with visions,
So*ld that my soul chooses strangling And*ild death rather than my body.
I*ld loathe my*i life;*i I*ld would not live forever. Let*ld me alone, For*ld my days are*i but*i a breath.
“What*ln is*i man, that You should exalt him, That*ild You should set Your heart on him,
That*ld You should visit him every morning, And*ild test him every moment?
How*ld long? Will*ld You not look away from me, And*ld let me alone till I swallow my saliva?
Have*ld I sinned? What*ld have I done to You, O watcher of men? Why*ld have You set me as Your target, So*ld that I am a burden to myself?
Why*ld then do You not pardon my transgression, And*ld take away my iniquity? For*ld now I will lie down in the dust, And*ld You will seek me diligently, But*ld I will*i no longer be.”*i
